Today is officially School Lunch Hero Day per Governor Baker. Their professionalism, comradery, and sense of humor have helped to brighten the days of so many during this trying time. We are so fortunate to have these wonderful employees, but more importantly people, as part of our BRRSD Team & Family. We are so appreciative & proud of you all! As always, I hope you and your loved ones are healthy & safe. I also hope that you are all having a successful first week of official remote learning. Therefore, there will be no remote learning scheduled for this Friday, April 10, 2020. A decision regarding April Vacation will be made at the Tuesday, April 14, 2020 Bridgewater-Raynham Regional School Committee Meeting. Please be assured that communication of the outcome will be shared with all BRRSD families & staff after the conclusion of the meeting. I thank you for your time and please stay well.

Respectfully,

Derek J. Swenson

The Bridgewater Raynham Girls Swim Team recently finished off their successful season with a fifth-place finish at the Division 1 State Championship Meet.

This was the highest team finish in school history. The Trojans accomplished this feat with seven swimmers, including juniors Megan Kramer, Shane Bridges and Emilie Fox, sophomores Abigail Szumita, Lily Martin and Kiley George, and freshman Jessie McNeil.

The girls were led by Junior Captain Megan Kramer. Megan won both of her individual events, the 200-yard individual medley and the 100-yard freestyle. She is now a four-time State Champion after winning an individual title her Freshman and Sophomore year. Megan's 200-yard individual medley time was also an All-American consideration time. She was Bridgewater-Raynham's first All-American swimmer last season as well.

Congratulations to Megan, all of the members of the Bridgewater Raynham Girls Swim Team and their Coach on an outstanding season. You have all once again brought great honor and pride to our District!

We are proud to announce that both teams and new Head Coach Haley Nolan earned the SEC Championship. This included two relay teams qualifying for sectional qualifying competition and one qualifying for the state championships. In all, we will have quite the representation at both competitions. The BRRSD, parents & the community at large could not be more of the accomplishments of these outstanding student-athletes & coaches. All of their hard work and dedication to the program has truly paid off. Kudos to you all!

The Bridgewater-Raynham Regional School District recognizes this need and has begun to work closely with the Raynham Park & Recreation Department to create a supplemental before and after school program at Raynham Middle School to assist Raynham families beginning in the 2019-2020 school year. If your child in currently on waitlist or your family is in search of a before or after school care option, we encourage to please contact the Raynham Park & Recreation Department at 508-824-2743 for more details. Thank you and enjoy the rest of your day.

post_text: Great News! The Superintendent of Schools Derek J. Swenson, Town Manager Michael Dutton and OPM Shane Nolan attended the MSBA Board of Directors Wednesday, April 10, 2019 in Boston. The Board of Directors voted unanimously to approve the preferred schematic design for the Mitchell School as submitted. This now allows the BRRSD to move into the Schematic Design phase. The next step will be to work through the Schematic Design with a target submission date of Wednesday, July 10, 2019. Our next School Building Committee meeting will be Monday, April 22, 2019 at 6:30 p.m. in the Town Council Chambers at the Academy Building. The MSBA Board Action Letter for the George H. Mitchell Elementary School Project can be found under DISTRICT HEADLINES on our website www.bridge-rayn.org. Thank you

Good Afternoon.
We hope this message finds you well. We are pleased to announce Mrs. Holly Hargraves as the next principal of the LaLiberte Elementary School. Mrs. Hargraves joins LaLiberte from TEC Connections where she was an Assistant Principal. Prior to TEC Connections, Mrs. Hargraves was employed in the Middleborough Public Schools as a Principal, Curriculum Director and the Director of Elementary Education. Prior to becoming an administrator, Mrs. Hargraves was a classroom teacher and a reading coach. We cannot thank the interview committee, faculty & staff, parents, and community members enough for their participation within this process and in providing us with their valuable feedback and insight. We know you will all join us in congratulating Mrs. Hargraves and in welcoming her to the LaLiberte Elementary School and BRRSD Family. Have a great weekend everyone.

Respectfully,

Derek J. Swenson, Superintendent of Schools
Ryan T. Powers, Assistant Superintendent of Schools
